page.title: 08An Insch Farmer's Day.
page.content: My day begins at 7.30am,unless it is lambing or harvest time.After break_ fast I go out and discuss the weather and then the kind of work that can be done with our farm worker. I then check the sheep to make sure that all is well and that none of them has landed on it's back. After the cattle have had an early morning feed and digested it,Alex,Jock and myself select animals which are fat and ready to be sold.We pen them up ready for floating to the mart for 11 o'clock. After reaching the mart they are inspected by the graders,numbered and put into pens. I usually go home for lunch,then return to the mart to watch the sale. After that I go home and take the tractor,sprayer and chemicals and head for the fields to be sprayed.
